org.openmuc.jmbus

Class DataRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openmuc.jmbus.DataRecord

  • public class DataRecord
extends java.lang.Object
    Representation of a data record (sometimes called variable data block). A data record is the basic data entity of the M-Bus application layer. A variable data structure contains a list of data records. Each data record represents a single data point. A data record consists of three fields: The data information block (DIB), the value information block (VIB) and the data field. The DIB codes the following parameters:
    • Storage number - a meter can have several storages e.g. to store historical time series data. The storage number 0 signals an actual value.
    • Function - data can have the following four function types: instantaneous value, max value, min value, value during error state.
    • Length and coding of the data field.
    • Tariff - indicates the tariff number of this data field. The data of tariff 0 is usually the sum of all other tariffs.
    • Subunit - can be used by a slave to distinguish several subunits of the metering device
    The VIB codes the following parameters:
    • Description - the meaning of the data value (e.g. "Energy", "Volume" etc.)
    • Unit - the unit of the data value.
    • Multiplier - a factor by which the data value coded in the data field has to be multiplied with. getScaledDataValue() returns the result of the data value multiplied with the multiplier.

      • getDib

        public byte[] getDib()
        Returns a byte array containing the DIB (i.e. the DIF and the DIFEs) contained in the data record.
        Returns:
        a byte array containing the DIB

      • getVib

        public byte[] getVib()
        Returns a byte array containing the VIB (i.e. the VIF and the VIFEs) contained in the data record.
        Returns:
        a byte array containing the VIB

      • getDataValue

        public java.lang.Object getDataValue()
        Returns the decoded data field of the data record as an Object. The Object is of one of the four types Long, Double, String or Date depending on information coded in the DIB/VIB. The DataType can be checked using getDataValueType().
        Returns:
        the data value

      • getDataValueType

        public DataRecord.DataValueType getDataValueType()

      • getScaledDataValue

        public java.lang.Double getScaledDataValue()
        Returns the data (value) multiplied by the multiplier as a Double. If the data is not a number than null is returned.
        Returns:
        the data (value) multiplied by the multiplier as a Double

      • getMultiplierExponent

        public int getMultiplierExponent()
        The multiplier is coded in the VIF. Is always a power of 10. This function returns the exponent. The base is always 10.
        Returns:
        the exponent of the multiplier.
